fields_of_interest: Education and training, Energy, Business and Industry, Environment, Regional Policy, Research and innovation
eu_initiatives: The efforts of the Association take place in the context of and contribute to the targets formulated in the Strategic Energy Technology (SET) Plan of the European Commission. In this sense EERA supports, catalyses and contributes to the implementation of the SET-Plan, specifically to the execution of the established Implementation Plans (IPs), while defining strategies to improve EU alignment of National Energy research efforts.
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
relevant_communication:
EERA is in relation with a wide range of stakeholders, from European Institutions (European Commission, European Parliament), to industry platforms (InnoEnergy, ETIPs and industrial association), to Member States representatives (SET Plan Steering group members). Also EERA is a priviledged advisor for the European Energy Research community, providing inputs for the European Research and Innovation Frameworks (Horizon 2020, Horizon Europe), interacting with several other platforms such as EUA, IRENA, or IEA.  
EERA is also very much involved in the organisation of conferences and workshops in the field of European Energy Policies and is a networking hub for its 17 Joint Research Programmes.
goals__remit: The purpose of the Association is to strengthen and to expand Europe's capabilities in sustainable energy research by connecting and joining European energy research activities. The coordinated and streamlined efforts of the Association, in particular the coordinated joining of different public research programmes at regional, member state and European level, shall enable all stakeholders of energy research to optimise their research efforts and to overcome fragmentation in order to accomplish a strategic and targeted development of next generations of energy technologies.
